text.#text: The table of sections at the beginning of

toc-entry.#text:
510. Preparation for and response to cyber
				emergencies.

header.#text:
Homeland
				defense activities: activities relating to preparation for and response to
				cyber emergencies

text.#text:
The homeland defense
				activities for which funds may be provided under this chapter shall include the
				following:

The provision by units or members of the
				National Guard of education and training for State and local law enforcement
				and governmental personnel on analysis and protection to prepare for and
				respond to emergencies involving an attack or natural disaster impacting a
				computer, electronic, or cyber network.

Upon the order of the Governor of the
				State, the performance by units or members of the National Guard of activities
				being undertaken by the State government and local governments in the State on
				analysis and protection to prepare for and respond to emergencies described in

The members of the National Guard who may
				perform activities authorized by this section are members on full-time National
				Guard duty under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 3(a) of the Cyber Warrior Act of
				2013

text.#text:
The activities performed by members under this section may
				be performed for or in support of cyber and computer network incident response
				teams established pursuant to

header.#text:
Performance in
				connection with cyber and computer network incident response
				teams

text.#text:
The performance of activities under this
				section by members of the National Guard shall not be subject to the
				requirements and limitations in

header.#text:
Inapplicability
				of certain requirements and limitations

				States.

, respectively, on analysis and protection to

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Armed Services of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on the training provided to members of
			 the Army National Guard and the Air National Guard pursuant to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Armed Services
			 of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on
			 the matters described in that paragraph. Each report shall include a
			 description of the training currently provided to members of the Army National
			 Guard and the Air National Guard on such matters, and such recommendations as
			 the Secretary considers appropriate for improvements to such training in order
			 to better align such training for members of the Army National Guard and the
			 Air National Guard, on the one hand, and members of the regular component of
			 the Army and the Air Force, on the other.

text.#text:
Not
			 later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, and annually
			 thereafter for four years, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Armed
			 Services of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report setting forth the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Armed Services of the House of
			 Representatives

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of
			 this Act, the

A
			 description and assessment of various mechanisms to recruit and retain members
			 of the regular components and reserve components of the Armed Forces with
			 expertise in computer network defense and operations, including modifications
			 of the curricula for the Reserve Officers' Training Corps programs, enhanced
			 opportunities for individuals to select their preferred Armed Force of
			 accession, payment of recruitment and retention bonuses, the provision of
			 educational scholarships and stipends, and enhanced funding of training and
			 certification programs.

An assessment of
			 the circumstances (including short-term deployment, virtual deployment, or
			 both) under which members of the reserve components with computer network
			 defense duties can be managed without the geographic relocation of such
			 members.

A
			 description of the training requirements and physical demands, if any, for
			 military occupational specialties relating to computer network defense.
